titleInfo.title: The Flutist's Monthly Bijou, Vol.2, No. 23

subject.topic: Jacksonian democracy and Tennessee's leadership role in the early republic .

mods.note: A collection of popular operatic airs arranged as solos and duets for the flute and violin. Contains: A Waltz in the Brewer of Preston (004898-CPMLG)/Adam, Osbourn, arr.; Hand Bell Waltz (004899-CPMLG)/Paganini, Osbourn, arr.; Tu Che a Dio (004900-CPMLG)/Donizetti, Osbourn, arr.; On to the Field of Glory (004901-CPM-LG)/Osbourn, arr.; Monterey Gallopade (004902-CPMLG)/Osbourne; It Was Not My Own Native Land (004902-CPMLG)/Brough, W.F., Osbourn, arr.; When Starts Are in the Quiet Skies (004904-CPMLG)/Carusi, Osbourn, arr.; The Lisping Lover (004905-CPMLG)/Blewet, J., Osbourn, arr.; A Wet Sheet and a Flowing Sea (004906-CPMLG)/Walton, Osbourn, arr.144. The Monterey Gallopade arrangement is significant because it is a musical expression of the spirit of American expansionism fueled by President James K. Polk.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guidelines (Version 3.5).
